alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Aroostook County through 245 PM EDT... At 202 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Russel Crossing, or 12 miles southwest of Portage, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Masardis, Nashville Plantation, Scopan, Castle Hill, Squa Pan and Garfield. This includes State Highway 11 between Masardis and Ashland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
